tasks.title: Fix Telegram voice messaging
tasks.description: Voice messages currently crash OpenClaw. Need to investigate and fix the crash issue to make voice messaging stable and reliable.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Root cause: OOM killer terminating gateway when whisper loads model. Server has 3.8GB RAM, no swap. Fix: switched to tiny model (73MB vs 139MB base). Config updated and gateway restarted.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Voice message test successful! Received and transcribed without crash. Tiny model fix confirmed working.

tasks.title: Fix Voice Message Gateway Crashes
tasks.description: After 2-3 voice messages, gateway becomes unresponsive and requires restart. Investigate memory/context issues with voice message processing. CRITICAL PRIORITY.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Updated OpenClaw from 2026.1.30 to 2026.2.2-3. This version includes fix #7475 'Media understanding: skip binary media from file text extraction' which should address the voice message context overflow issue.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Stability test in progress: 6/10 voice messages processed successfully with no crashes. Update to 2026.2.2-3 appears to have fixed the issue.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: STABILITY TEST PASSED: 10/10 voice messages processed successfully including a 2.5 minute stress test. Update to 2026.2.2-3 confirmed to fix the binary media context overflow issue. Ready for final approval.

tasks.title: Activity Monitor Research & Improvement

Deliverables: Comprehensive PDF report + voice summary under 2 min.

tasks.title: Token Usage Tracking & Cost Visualization
tasks.description:
OBJECTIVE: Build a LIVE token usage tracking system with cost visualization for GitHub Copilot billing

EXPECTATIONS FROM ANTHONY:
- Track total token usage over time with visual chart - LIVE updates
- Show cost per task/agent breakdown (which work consumes most tokens)
- Hierarchical breakdown: Heartbeat vs Tasks vs Ad-hoc conversations
- Display BOTH tokens AND estimated cost
- All visualizations must auto-refresh (within 30 seconds)
- Token Tracking is a NEW dedicated page in Agent Activity Monitor
- Update ACTIVE AGENTS page to show tokens + cost per agent
- Update HISTORY page to show tokens + cost for historical agents
- THREE visualization types: Line chart (over time), Stacked bar (per-task), Treemap (hierarchical)
- **BASELINE TRACKING**: Store a "starting balance" value provided by Anthony from GitHub billing
- **CUMULATIVE COST**: Add tracked costs to the baseline, so total shown matches GitHub billing
- **PREDICTION ACCURACY**: When Anthony checks GitHub billing, the value should match what's displayed
- **BILLING CYCLE RESET**: Support monthly reset when billing cycle completes (Anthony will notify)

CONSTRAINTS:
- Use GitHub Copilot billing rates (must research exact per-model costs)
- Must handle multiple models: Opus ($15/$75), Sonnet ($3/$15), GPT-4o ($2.50/$10), GPT-4o-mini ($0.15/$0.60), Gemini Pro ($1.25/$5)
- Integrate with existing Agent Activity Monitor (monitor_server.py)

DELIVERABLES:
1. Token logging infrastructure capturing per-request usage
2. NEW dedicated Token Tracking page in Activity Monitor with 3 visualizations
3. Updated Active Agents page with tokens + cost per agent
4. Updated History page with tokens + cost for historical agents
5. Live auto-refresh (30 second intervals)
6. **Baseline cost storage** - ability to set starting balance from GitHub billing
7. **Cumulative total display** - baseline + tracked usage = total shown
8. Cost prediction that matches GitHub billing

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Can see at a glance: total spend, per-agent breakdown, per-task costs
- Refresh within 30 seconds shows updated data
- Anthony provides baseline, tracks for days, checks GitHub - values match
- Monthly reset capability when Anthony notifies of new billing cycle

subtasks.title: Research GitHub Copilot token pricing - confirm rates per model
Design token logging schema: task_id, agent_id, model, input_tokens, output_tokens, timestamp
Implement token tracking hooks in OpenClaw (capture per-request)
Build cost calculation engine - apply correct rate per model
Create NEW Token Tracking page in monitor_server.py
Add LINE CHART - total usage over time with cost overlay
Add STACKED BAR CHART - per-task breakdown with cost labels
Add TREEMAP/SUNBURST - hierarchical breakdown (Heartbeat/Tasks/Ad-hoc)
Update ACTIVE AGENTS page - show tokens + cost per agent card
Update AGENT HISTORY page - show tokens + cost for historical agents
Implement auto-refresh (30 second intervals) for all views
Add Token Tracking nav link to all pages in Activity Monitor
Test and calibrate cost estimates against actual GitHub billing
Add baseline cost storage (JSON file with starting_balance, date_set, cycle_start)
Create /set-baseline endpoint to accept Anthony's GitHub billing value
Update Token Tracking page: show baseline + tracked = total
Add 'Reset for New Billing Cycle' button/endpoint

Will store starting balance from GitHub billing, add tracked costs cumulatively, so displayed total matches actual GitHub billing. Added 4 new subtasks: sub_014-017 for baseline storage, set-baseline endpoint, cumulative display, and billing cycle reset.

tasks.title: Mission Control: Last Updated Timestamps + Auto-Sort by Recent
tasks.description:
OBJECTIVE: Show last updated time on task cards and sort by most recently updated

EXPECTATIONS FROM ANTHONY:
- Every task card on dashboard shows "Updated: X time ago" or "Updated: 1:45 PM" BEFORE opening
- When ANY change happens to a task (subtask added/crossed off, comment added, status change), timestamp updates
- Tasks within each column (backlog, in_progress, review) sorted by MOST RECENTLY UPDATED at top
- I can see at a glance which tasks are being actively worked on
- Agent MUST add a comment whenever crossing off subtasks, adding subtasks, or making any change
- This behavior must be HARDCODED into identity files (HEARTBEAT.md, AGENTS.md, SOUL.md)
- Must create a SKILL that enforces this behavior for future reference

CONSTRAINTS:
- Must work with existing Mission Control dashboard
- Must update in real-time with auto-refresh
- Sorting must be per-column (not global)

DELIVERABLES:
1. Dashboard update: Show "Updated: [timestamp]" on each task card (visible without clicking)
2. Dashboard update: Sort tasks within each column by lastUpdated descending (newest first)
3. mc CLI update: Ensure every operation updates the lastUpdated field
4. Identity file updates: HEARTBEAT.md, AGENTS.md, SOUL.md - hardcode the rule to always add comments on changes
5. Create skill or script that documents/enforces this behavior
6. Auto-comment on subtask changes (when crossing off, adding, or modifying subtasks)

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Anthony can see which tasks were updated most recently without opening them
- Most recently updated tasks float to top of each column
- Every subtask change triggers a comment explaining what changed
- Agent behavior is hardcoded - never forgets to update timestamps and add comments

subtasks.title: Add lastUpdated display to task cards in dashboard HTML
Implement per-column sorting by lastUpdated (newest first)
Update mc CLI to set lastUpdated on every operation
Update HEARTBEAT.md - add rule to always comment on changes
Update AGENTS.md - add rule to always comment on changes
Update SOUL.md - add rule to always comment on changes
Create skill/script documenting this behavior
Test: verify subtask changes trigger comments and timestamp updates
Test: mc CLI now updates lastUpdated on every operation

Moving to review.

tasks.title: Google Calendar Integration via gcalcli
tasks.description:
OBJECTIVE: Set up Google Calendar integration using gcalcli OAuth

EXPECTATIONS FROM ANTHONY:
- Be able to view all events, meetings, tasks from university Google Calendar
- Help with scheduling and reminders
- Check conflicts before scheduling

CONSTRAINTS:
- University Google Workspace account (may have IT restrictions)
- Use gcalcli OAuth flow (Option 1 - simplest)

DELIVERABLES:
1. gcalcli installed and authenticated
2. Verify read access to calendar events
3. Document any limitations from university IT

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Can list upcoming events
- Can create/modify events
- Calendar data accessible to OpenClaw

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Created task. Anthony will run gcalcli init himself. Waiting for him to complete OAuth flow.
